description: From wit +‎ -craft. 1573 by Ralph Lever, The Arte of Reason, rightly termed, Witcraft, teaching a perfect way to argue and dispute.

entries.meaning: Art or skill of the mind; mental skill; contrivance; invention; the art of wit.
examples: In its pure form, witcraft can be seen as a democratic art. because it does not depend upon technical expertise. Within an ideal context of pure witcraft, the powerful and the powerless meet upon equal terms.
It argues that a rhetorical approach maintains space for agency on the behalf of employees (through the witcraft of argument)  […]
